intro: Leucanthemum praecox var. autumnale, commonly known as the autumn oxeye daisy, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe. It features showy white petals with a yellow center, blooming in late summer to early autumn. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun to partial shade and prefers well-drained soil. This variety is valued for its ornamental appeal and ability to attract pollinators.
